intro: Astragalus montis-alamkuhi, commonly known as the Alaskan mountain milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of Alaska. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it forms dense mats to conserve moisture. Astragalus montis-alamkuhi plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for local wildlife. Its limited distribution makes it a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
